test_cases.objective: Verify that the system accurately monitors temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with ±0.5°C accuracy.

test_steps.action: Set up the reference thermometer in the same environment as the EMS sensor.
test_steps.expected_result: Reference thermometer displays stable temperature reading.

test_steps.action: Record the temperature displayed by the EMS and compare it to the reference thermometer.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS temperature reading is within ±0.5°C of the reference thermometer.

test_steps.action: Repeat the test at three different temperature points (-80°C, 0°C, +50°C).
test_steps.expected_result: All readings are within the specified accuracy range.

acceptance_criteria: All temperature readings must be within ±0.5°C of the reference thermometer.
System must maintain accuracy across the full specified range.
regulatory_basis: 21 CFR Part 11 compliance for electronic records
data_integrity_requirements: All test data must be recorded and stored in the vendor's standard database format.
Audit trail must capture all test activities.

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from setpoint and integrates with the site paging system.
prerequisites: Site paging system available for integration

test_steps.action: Set a temperature setpoint (e.g., 5°C) in the EMS.
test_steps.expected_result: Setpoint is successfully saved and displayed in the system.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation of +2.1°C (e.g., 7.1°C) using a test environment.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an audible and visual alarm within 30 seconds.

test_steps.action: Verify that the alarm notification is received by the site paging system.
test_steps.expected_result: Paging system displays the alarm notification correctly.

test_steps.action: Repeat the test for a -2.1°C deviation (e.g., 2.9°C).
test_steps.expected_result: All alarm conditions are triggered and notifications are received.

acceptance_criteria: Alarms must be generated within 30 seconds of deviation.
Notifications must be correctly received by the paging system.
data_integrity_requirements: Alarm events must be recorded in the audit trail.
All test data must be stored in the vendor's standard format.

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system accurately monitors temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with ±0.5°C accuracy.

test_steps.action: Set up the system with a calibrated temperature reference device in a controlled environment.
test_steps.expected_result: System recognizes the reference device and displays temperature readings.

test_steps.action: Adjust the controlled environment to various temperatures within the range (-80°C to +50°C).
test_steps.expected_result: System records temperatures within ±0.5°C of the reference device.

acceptance_criteria: All temperature readings must be within ±0.5°C of the reference device values.
regulatory_basis: 21 CFR Part 11 compliance for accurate data recording
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be stored in vendor's standard database format per URS-EMS-006

test_cases.objective: Verify that alarm notifications are correctly integrated with the site paging system using the vendor API.
prerequisites: Site paging system available and operational

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation exceeding ±2°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert as specified in URS-EMS-005.

test_steps.action: Verify the alert is received by the site paging system via the vendor API.
test_steps.expected_result: Paging system receives and displays the alarm notification within 30 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notifications must be received by the paging system within 30 seconds of generation.
regulatory_basis: 21 CFR Part 11 compliance for timely alarm notifications
data_integrity_requirements: Alarm data must be stored in vendor's standard database format per URS-EMS-006

test_cases.test_name: Verify Temperature Monitoring Accuracy and Alert Generation
test_cases.objective: To verify that the EMS accurately monitors temperature and generates alerts when deviations occur.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 25°C and introduce a deviation of +2.5°C.
test_steps.expected_result: The system should generate an alert within 30 seconds.

test_steps.action: Introduce a deviation of -2.5°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: The system should generate an alert within 30 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: Alerts are generated within 30 seconds for both deviations
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all temperature readings are recorded accurately

test_cases.test_name: Verify Integration with Facility Management System
test_cases.objective: To verify that the EMS successfully interfaces with the existing facility management system.

test_steps.action: Send a test temperature reading from the EMS to the facility management system.
test_steps.expected_result: The facility management system should receive and display the temperature reading.

test_steps.action: Trigger an alarm in the EMS and verify notification in the facility management system.
test_steps.expected_result: The facility management system should display the alarm notification.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notifications are received and displayed
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all transmitted data is accurate and complete

test_cases.test_name: Verify Temperature Monitoring Accuracy and Alarm Generation
test_cases.objective: To ensure the system accurately monitors temperature and generates alarms when deviations occur.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 25°C and introduce a deviation of +2.5°C.
test_steps.expected_result: The system should generate an alarm within 30 seconds.

test_steps.action: Introduce a deviation of -2.5°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: The system should generate an alarm within 30 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: Alarms are generated within 30 seconds for both deviations
data_integrity_requirements: All data must be stored in the vendor's standard database format

test_cases.test_name: Verify Integration with Facility Management System
test_cases.objective: To ensure the system interfaces correctly with the existing facility management system.

test_steps.action: Send a test temperature reading from the EMS to the facility management system.
test_steps.expected_result: The facility management system should receive and display the temperature reading correctly.

test_steps.action: Send a test alarm notification from the EMS to the facility management system.
test_steps.expected_result: The facility management system should receive and log the alarm notification correctly.

acceptance_criteria: Temperature readings and alarm notifications are correctly received and displayed by the facility management system
data_integrity_requirements: All data must be stored in the vendor's standard database format

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint as per URS-EMS-005.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 25°C in the system configuration.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts the setpoint and displays it correctly.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature reading of 27.5°C (exceeding +2°C deviation).
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert within 30 seconds as per URS-EMS-011.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature reading of 22.5°C (exceeding -2°C deviation).
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert within 30 seconds as per URS-EMS-011.

acceptance_criteria: Alerts are generated for both +2°C and -2°C deviations
Alert messages contain correct temperature values
data_integrity_requirements: Alert records must be stored in the vendor's standard database format per URS-EMS-006

test_cases.objective: Verify successful integration between EMS and facility management system using standard protocols per URS-EMS-014.
prerequisites: Both systems are installed and operational
Network connectivity between systems is established

test_steps.action: Initiate a temperature alert in the EMS system.
test_steps.expected_result: Alert notification appears in facility management system within 30 seconds.

test_steps.action: Send a test command from facility management system to request current temperature data.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS responds with correct temperature data within 30 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: All test communications complete within 30 seconds
Data transferred between systems maintains accuracy
No data corruption occurs during transfer
data_integrity_requirements: Data must maintain integrity during transfer between systems
All integration events must be recorded in audit trail
